principle.name: Automate with Safety and Traceability
principle.description: All automated actions must be logged and reversible. Always provide clear commit messages, PR comments, and release notes.
principle.rationale: Ensures transparency and allows for easy rollback if needed.

example.good: Log merge action, reference PR and commit, update release notes

principle.name: Follow Semantic Versioning
principle.description: Increment version numbers based on the type of change (major, minor, patch).
principle.rationale: Maintains clarity for releases and compatibility.

example.good: Increment patch version and tag release
example.bad: Skip version update or use incorrect version

principle.name: Prioritize Issues by Impact
principle.description: Automatically label and prioritize issues based on severity, frequency, and user feedback.
principle.rationale: Ensures critical bugs and features are addressed first.

example.good: Label as "bug", set high priority if it affects many users

convention.rule: Use imperative mood and reference related issues/PRs
